channel.title: Overview on Mac Strelioff
channel.description: Recent content in Overview on Mac Strelioff

item.title: Square
item.description: Square job HM Phone Call Deeksha lead for growth DS at Square prior to that … worked at digital ad startup Over 10 years of experience Square started payment processing, now more of a business solutions company more than 30 products verticle point of sale product support for invoices all tools needed to sell something Also have giant ecosystem of Cash app, over 20 million consumers, growing rapidly going to become a banking app soon.

item.title: Facebook
item.description: Onsite Prep Marketing metrics Marketing specific: Incrementality (lift that wouldn’t have happened but for the ad) CPA (cost per acquisition) ROAS (return on ad spend) ROI (return on investment) PPC (pay per click) One ROI formula: \[ \begin{aligned} n_{leads} &: \text{Number of leads} \\ p_c &: \text{Lead to customer conversion rate} \\ \bar{s} &:\text{Average sales price per customer} \\ ROI &:\frac{n_{leads} p_c \bar{s} - cost}{cost} \end{aligned} \]

item.title: Probability and Statistics
item.description: Probability Foundations Probability Rules Probability Functions Transformations of Random Variables Expectation Variance Information Theory Causal Graphs Causal Inference Framework Key Assumptions Common Methods Diff in Diff Synthetic Control and Causal Impact Synthetic Controls IV Analysis Regression Discontinuity Fixed Effects Regression First differences Random Effects Propensity Score Matching Microsoft DoWhy Efficient Inference Efficient Sampling Efficient Designs Efficient Models Experiment Design Foundations Concerns Treatment Units Generative Model and Adjustment Variables Common Designs Assignment Mechanism Duration Integrety Checks Maximum Likelihood versus Bayes’ Estimators GLMs Common Tests t-test ANOVA Linear Model Z test for proportions Chi-Square Logistic Regression Likelihood Ratio and Bayes Factors always valid p-values (ck optimizely white paper) Different Estimands For CI more on variance Emperical Variance Estimation Mixed Effects Models Effiencicy or Variance Reduction GLMs Causal Inference Methods Difference in Differences Causal Impact Synthetic Controls Propensity Score Matching Fixed Effects Regression Instrumental variables Regression Discontinuity Probability Foundations A random variable random variable is a variable with an unknown value, but known possible values.

item.title: Pinterest
item.description: TODO: Phrase all projects in a way that conveys the value I bring to Pinterest Be able to talk about past projects and their use cases or value – Use STAR to connect with interviewers over each experience. Be able to talk about differences in efficiency between different estimators; see efficiency, and robust statistics Be able to talk about ATE vs ATT, and other causal inference methods. Be able to list key metrics for growth, retention, engagement (mentioned throughout quarterly filing), pin relevance Be able to do basic analyses in pandas Be able to outline and work through experimentation problems Be able to list growth strategies

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: Considerations Bias-variance trade-off Overfitting and Underfitting Cost Functions and Metrics Feature Engineering Seperability Assumptions about form of relationship Unsupervised Clustering k-means Agglomerative Devisive Matrix Decomposition PCA Principle Components Analysis SVD Singular Value Decomposition Text-based LDA Latent Direchilote Analysis LSA Latent Semantic Analysis Supervised Regression Linear Support Vector Machine (SVM) Classification Naive Bayes Discriminant Analysis KNN Logistic Regression Ensemble Methods Trees and Forests Regression Classification Open ended Template Raw data structure?

item.title: Product Sense
item.description: Question Types Experimentation: “Launching new app/feature, how do you determine if it is a success?” Unexpected Change: “Your manager sees a sharp, sudden drop in satisfaction survey scores, how do you investigate this?” Businesses and Products Characterize the Company and Explore its Products Summarize the business in 2-3 sentences List Offerings/Products/Features End Users/Customers Describe User Journey How does the company monetize? Identify Metrics (high level and product specific) Growth/Retention Engagement/Transactions Monetization Brainstorm Business Problems Develop for specific Products and Business Areas

item.title: Behavioral Interviewing
item.description: Principles Evaluation Common Behavioral Questions “Tell me a little about your background.” Child bandits: “Tell me about the project you worked on at Insight.” “Why are you interested in a career as a data scientist?” “Tell me about your research / talk to me about your last role.” “Why are you interested in joining this company?” “Talk about a time you were on a team that struggled with effective communication.

item.title: Instacart Notes
item.description: TODO: Check out info from blog Read articles on their DS blog LinkedIn application for data scientist Instacart posting for data scientist LinkedIn app for analyst Recruiter call “Just be prepared to share with me what you are looking for, what is exciting to you and feel free to have questions ready about the team, role, business etc” Groceries have been hard for internet companies to get right – it’s exciting to see Instacart managing this well, and I’d be excited to be a part of this technological revolution of grocery delivery More about role?

item.title: SQL Solutions
item.description: General Queries and Tricks Window Functions Subqueries Aggregation and window Formatting and Strings Dates Other Stanford Lagunita Course SQL Movie-Rating Query Exercises SQL Movie-Rating Query Exercises Extras SQL Social-Network Query Exercises SQL Social-Network Query Exercises Extras PG exercises, aggregates select problems General Queries and Tricks SELECT (column names to select) [AS (name for selection)] FROM (table to select from) [INNER,LEFT,RIGHT,OUTTER] JOIN table2 ON [join keys and conditionals] WHERE (logical condition on rows) column = (value or subquery), OR column IN (list or subquery) GROUP BY (column[,column,.

item.title: Basic Computer Science
item.description: Foundations Complexity Computational Complexity Constant Time: O(1) Logrithmic Time: O(log(n)) Polynomial Time: O(n), O(n^2), … Exponential Time: \(O(x^n)\) Data Structures Lists and Dictionaries Queues and Stacks Graphs and Trees Sorting Searching Linear Search: Binary Search Graph Search Breadth First (BFS) and queues Depth First (DFS) DFS vs BFS Examples: Pointers Algorithms TODO / Other Topics: Recursion; Dijkstra’s algorithm dynamic programming (knapsack problem, Fibonacci sequence) Functional programming Tools Git and GitHub SQL General Structure of SQL querys Aggregation functions Window functions Tricks: Resources Foundations Data type manipulation (char, string, numeric, binary, ascii) regular expressions;

item.title: Wealthfront Notes
item.description: TODO: Looking for: “You enjoy mentoring others on subjects such as causal inference, experimental design, data visualization or behavioral psychology” Make a few videos on experimentation and causal inference Work on: “You subscribe to Wealthfront’s values and mission and can articulate the reasons why, and have an understanding of our product, business model and key metrics” Job Description Projects, Tasks, and Data Work closely with a cross-functional growth team of marketers, product managers, and engineers to generate new ideas for growth especially top of funnel, translating open-ended business issues into data questions, identifying practical analytic and A/B testing approaches to validate the ideas, and defining ongoing checks post-implementation to ensure that the growth mechanisms are working as planned.

item.title: LinkedIn Notes
item.description: Company Visit Chris info – Recruiter Call Recruiter emails II & III – Interviews Schedule and interviewers: 10:00-10:45 | Host Leader | Joonhyung Lim 10:45-11:30 | Statistical Modeling | Dongping (sunny) Jing and Caitlin Crump: 11:30-12:30 | Lunch | Nuo Wang 12:30-1:15 | Data Manipulation | Xianyun Mao: 1:15-2:00 | Statistics & A/B Testing | | Qiannan Yin and Yuan Chai: 2:00-2:45 | Analytics Case Study | Gigi Zhang: Users Current issues Ideas and excitement Excitement from Recruiter Onsite Glassdoor interview questions Knowledge gaps Next steps Company Visit Chris info – DS people generally get interviewed on computer engineering topics – eg implementing data structures from scratch, … Interview centrally for AI organization, then get matched with a team.

item.title: Yelp Notes
item.description: TODO: compute common business metrics from Yelp dataset. Product deep dive Company Visit Business Model, Culture, and Vision Mission: Connect people with great local places Main source of revenue is business ads, overview of offerings here More services for businesses Want: openness, curiosity, approachable DS team has “Office hours” to facilitate communication Journal clubs and learning groups Can move to PM or ML teams Projects, Tasks, and Data Working on personalization e.
